definitions.definition: A short, quick movement , especially a brush , sweep , or flip .
examples: He removed the speck of dust with a flick of his finger.
She gave a disdainful flick of her hair and marched out of the room.

definitions.definition: A motion picture , movie , film ; (in plural, usually preceded by "the") movie theater , cinema .
examples: My all-time favorite flick is "Gone with the Wind."
Want to go to the flicks tonight?

definitions.definition: A cut that lands with the point, often involving a whip of the foible of the blade to strike at a concealed target.
The act of pressing a place on a touch screen device.
A unit of time , equal to 1/705,600,000 of a second
A chap or fellow; sometimes as a friendly term of address .

main_definition: A short, quick movement , especially a brush , sweep , or flip .
secondary_definitions: ( informal ) A motion picture , movie , film ; (in plural, usually preceded by "the") movie theater , cinema .
( fencing ) A cut that lands with the point, often involving a whip of the foible of the blade to strike at a concealed target.
( tennis ) A powerful underarm volley shot .
The act of pressing a place on a touch screen device.
A unit of time , equal to 1/705,600,000 of a second
( dated , slang ) A chap or fellow; sometimes as a friendly term of address .
